00014 // .NAME vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode - 
00015 // .SECTION Description
00016 // This sub-node should contain information specific to each
00017 // type of volume that needs to be read in.  This can be used
00018 // to clean up the special cases in this file which handle
00019 // volumes of various types, such as dicom, header, etc.  In
00020 // future these things can be moved to the sub-node specific for that
00021 // type of volume.  The sub-nodes here that describe specific volume
00022 // types each correspond to an implementation of the reader/writer,
00023 // which can be found in a vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite subclass.
00024 
00025 #ifndef __vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode_h
00026 #define __vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode_h
00027 
00028 #include "vtkMrmlNode.h"
00029 #include "vtkSlicer.h"
00030 
00031 class VTK_SLICER_BASE_EXPORT vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode : public vtkMrmlNode
00032 {
00033   public:
00034   static vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode *New();
00035   vtkTypeMacro(vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode,vtkMrmlNode);
00036   void PrintSelf(ostream& os, vtkIndent indent);
00037   
00038   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00039   // Utility Functions
00040   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00041  
00042   // Description:
00043   // Copy the node's attributes to this object
00044   void Copy(vtkMrmlNode *node);
00045 
00046   // Description:
00047   // Write the node's attributes to a MRML file in XML format
00048   void Write(ofstream& of, int indent);
00049   
00050   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051   // Specifics for each type of volume data
00052   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 
00054   // Type of vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode we are.  This must be written to 
00055   // the MRML file so when it is read back in, a node of this type
00056   // can be created.
00057   vtkGetStringMacro(ReaderType);
00058 
00059   // Subclasses will add more here to handle their types of volume
00060 
00061 protected:
00062   vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode();
00063   ~vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode();
00064   vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode(const vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode&) {};
00065   void operator=(const vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode&) {};
00066 
00067   vtkSetStringMacro(ReaderType);
00068   char *ReaderType;
00069 };
00070 
00071 #endif
